title: The Psychology of Language
description: An analysis of human communication as a function of psychological, linguistic, and social factors. Focuses on language comprehension and production, including the processing of sounds, words, syntax, semantics, pragmatics, and dialogue.

conditions.restricted_to_majors: psychology and cognitive science majors and minors.

pre_req_data.text: Prerequisite(s): PSYC 100. Enrollment is restricted to psychology and cognitive science majors and minors.

class_notes: Enroll in lecture and associated discussion section
